Erika Gottlieb: George Orwell's dystopias : Animal farm and Nineteen Eighty-Four. Bernard Schweizer: Evelyn Waugh's Brideshead revisited and other late novels. Patrick A. McCarthy: Modernism's swansong : Malcolm Lowrys's Under the volcano. Cedric Watts: The heart of the matter and the later novels of Graham Greene. Kevin McCarron: William Golding's Lord of the flies and other early novels. Merritt Moseley: Amis, father and son. Margaret Moan Rowe: Dame Iris Murdoch. Kenneth Womack: The campus novel in context. Julius Rowan Raper: Lawrence Durrell's Alexandria quartet. Peter J. Schakel: The Oxford fantasists : C.S. Lewis and J.R.R. Tolkien. Bryan Cheyette: Muriel Spark's The prime of Miss Jean Brodie. Judith Kegan Gardiner: Doris Lessing's The golden notebook. John J. Su: Jean Rhys's Wide Sargasso sea. James Acheson: John Fowles's The French leutenant's woman. Nicola Pitchford: Angela Carter. Margaret Moan Rowe: Margaret Drabble. Timothy Weiss: V.S. Naipaul. Nico Israel: Salman Rushdie. Donna Potts: The Irish novel after Joyce. Cheryl Alexander Malcolm: Anita Brookner. Merritt Moseley: Julian Barnes's Flaubert's parrot. Cynthia F. Wong: Kazuo Ishiguro's The remains of the day. Rebecca L. Walkowitz: Ian McEwan. Donald P. Kaczvinsky: Graham Swift. David Goldie: The Scottish new wave. Lynn Wells: A.S. Byatt's Possession : a romance. Anne Whitehead: Pat Barker's Regeneration trilogy)

title.$: Inside the Whale : and Other Essays

abstract.$: George Orwell's moving describtion of the death of an elephant is representative of the humanitarian instincts he found it impossible to repress. In all these essays - from a journey down a coal mine toanalysis of the penny "dreadfuls" - he fulfils his role as the social concience of his age.
